title: Restaurant POS and the Best Way to Choose It
text:
Restaurant POS and the Best Way to Choose It By Ashok Karni   15, 2015 
Evaluation of a Point Of Sale system can often be an overwhelming task even while you are a tech savvy person. Sky is the limit as far as vendors are concerned. There are so many solutions and vendors in the market to select from and so the million dollar question is how you can find out a POS that is just right for your company. 
Do you remember those days when you had maintained a cash register in your restaurant and had to literally shout when communicating with the kitchen guys? Technology has indeed changes the way a business functions at present. Today a majority of the successful restaurants have been taking complete advantage of a POS system for controlling costs as well as to expand their businesses. These restaurant operators are well acquainted with the merits of thorough and extensive research and know what questions they should ask for finding out the right system for their restaurants. If you own a restaurant, here are some of the points that you should keep in your mind when shopping for POS and also to know what you should ask to the POS vendors. 
1. Be flexible and open to choice: You should keep an open mind and have your options open. Technology is always known to change quite rapidly so you must select a POS provider who has a reputation in the market for implementing regular upgrades and providing a solution that is both flexible and open so that integrating a new technology solution happens seamlessly. But how do you tell that? For a change you can ask a vendor what integration tools or API he or she can offer for linking a POS with the systems in the head office or with third-party applications and apps. 
2. Labor and food cost controls: A Restaurant POS Billing Software should have the capability for tracking employee hours, pay levels and multiple jobs. The POS should also have built-I labor planning and sales forecasting tools for predicting sales as well as staffing requirements for meeting your labor targets. It should offer an integrated scheduling feature so that the business volume that you could be expecting on each day and each hour could be planned and predicted properly and can be further broken down for dine-in, carry-out and delivery. You may also want that your POS should be helping you in cutting food cost by minimizing human wastes and errors. By making the best out of portion and inventory control characteristics and several other loss prevention tools you can get more profits by reducing your food cost. You should also ask the vendor how his POS can save your food and labor costs and ask him to show you some customer examples. 
3. Accuracy in Analytics and Reporting: It is critical to know your figures on your fingertips. The POS that you deploy should have the ability to quickly and accurately deliver the numbers whenever you need them. From labor statistics to customer data and from sales figures to detailed reports and analytics, all these help you to eradicate any scope of making guesswork from managing your restaurant. Do not forget to find out from the vendor about how easy it would be for you to access your store reports anytime and anywhere? If the answer is yes, ask him how it can be done.
